Description: To resolve a lawsuit brought by the California Attorney General, Frito-Lay agreed to pay $600,000 and slash levels of the cancer-causing chemical acrylamide in its potato chips.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/atty-gen-brown-settles-potato-chip-lawsuit-heinz-frito-lay-kettle-foods

Description: The New York Attorney General reached agreement with six companies to reduce air pollution caused by idling trucks and buses. As part of the settlement the firms agreeed to pay a total of $110,343. The announcement did not specify how the payment would be divided among the companies. Here we assume it was split evenly among them.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20101116003528/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2002/jun/jun18a_02.html

Description: Pepsi Bottling Group was fined $200,000 and agreed to pay $2.78 million for clean-up project to settle allegations of unlawfully discharging wastes into New York waterways and sewer systems in three upstate counties.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20101119015736/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2004/jul/jul14b_04.html

Description: PepsiCo., Inc. agreed to pay $2.25 million and eliminate leaded labels on bottled soft drinks imported from Mexico to resolve allegations Pepsi violated Proposition 65 by failing to warn consumers the labels contained lead.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-lockyer-announces-multi-million-dollar-settlement-pepsi
https://web.archive.org/web/20101116010835/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2002/feb/feb01a_02.html

Description: South Beach Beverage Co., owned by Pepsico, agreed to pay $219,000 in settlement of allegations it made unproven claims about the health benefits of its drinks.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20061219062756/http://www.ct.gov/ag/cwp/view.asp?A=1949&Q=289996

Company: Stacy's Pita Chips and Optimum Corporation, Inc.
Description: A snack food company and its temp agency agreed to pay nearly $400,000 to resolve allegations of unpaid overtime wages.
Info Source: Randolph Snack Food Manufacturer and Temp Agency Pays $400,000 in Backwages and Penalties for Failure to Pay Employees Overtime, States News Service, April 12, 2007 (via Nexis).

Description: The California Attorney General announced a settlement involving allegations that The Gatorade Company violated California consumer protection laws by making misleading statements about water in a mobile videogame application it used to promote Gatorade sports drinks to teens and young adults.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-becerra-announces-settlement-gatorade-over-allegedly-misleading

Description: PepsiCo Inc., responding to a probe by the Los Angeles City Attorney's Office and the state Attorney General's Office, agreed to pay $2.25 million and stop using bottles imported from Mexico with lead-based paint on them.
Info Source: PepsiCo Agrees to Stop Using Bottles with Lead-Based Paint, City News Service, April 21, 2006 (via Nexis).
